description: A binary sequence: a(1) = 10 (2 in decimal) and a(n+1) is obtained by trying to complement just one bit of a(n), starting with the least significant bit, until a new prime is reached.
comments: This is the lexicographically least (in positions of the flipped bits) such sequence.It is not known if the sequence is infinite.
crossrefs: The decimal sequence is given in A059459. A base-ten analog is in A059471.
author: _Gregory Allen_, Feb 02 2001
extensions: More terms from _David W. Wilson_, Feb 05 2001. For many further terms (but written in base 10) see A059459.
